text: the Japanese have had a very interesting
response to the American criticisms on
Wednesday that more needs to be done
about the troubled nuclear power plant
the chairman of the United States
Nuclear Regulatory Commission said on
Wednesday that the United States was
very worried about a storage pool for
spent uranium fuel rods at the top of
reactor 4 we believe at this point that
unit form may have lost a significant
inventory if not if not lost all of its
water the Japanese government however
took a somewhat different approach today
in trying to combat problems at the
troubled nuclear power plant they had
helicopters drop water on reactor 3
while initially disputing the storage
pond at reactor 4 had trouble although
they later acknowledged that there were
severe problems at that storage pool as
well so why are the Japanese so worried
about reactor 3 1 strong possibility is
that reactor 3 unlike the other reactors
has what is known as a mixed oxide fuel
which has reclaimed plutonium in it in
addition to uranium and your nuclear
engineers in the West have said that if
that plutonium is dispersed through
fires or explosions that would produce a
and even more hazardous radioactive
plume than the dispersal of the uranium
fuel rods found in the other five
reactors at the site unfortunately the
Japanese have already indicated that the
helicopter drops on reactor 3 do not
appear to have been successful there was
quite a bit of wind blowing and so as a
result the latest effort is to try to
use water cannon to try to get water
into reactor 3 water cannons are usually
used by police to try to disperse
rioters so what the Japanese authorities
are really trying to do here is
improvise try to find new solutions to
new problems that keep coming up every
day
you
